EXAMPLE.name: exact_match
EXAMPLE.description: Exact word match. \b = word boundary (prevents matching 'EXAMPLES' or 'MYEXAMPLE')

EXAMPLE.name: case_insensitive_variations
EXAMPLE.description: Matches EXAMPLE, example, Example, ExAmPlE etc. Each [Xx] matches either case.

EXAMPLE.name: word_with_numbers
EXAMPLE.description: EXAMPLE followed by one or more digits. Matches EXAMPLE1, EXAMPLE123, EXAMPLE999999

EXAMPLE.name: word_with_optional_numbers
EXAMPLE.description: EXAMPLE followed by zero or more digits. Matches EXAMPLE, EXAMPLE1, EXAMPLE123

EXAMPLE.name: word_with_fixed_digits
EXAMPLE.description: EXAMPLE followed by exactly 3 digits. Matches EXAMPLE123 but NOT EXAMPLE12 or EXAMPLE1234

EXAMPLE.name: word_with_digit_range
EXAMPLE.description: EXAMPLE followed by 2-4 digits. Matches EXAMPLE12, EXAMPLE123, EXAMPLE1234

EXAMPLE.name: prefix_variations
EXAMPLE.description: Non-capturing group (?:...) for prefix options. Matches TEST_EXAMPLE1, PROD_EXAMPLE99

EXAMPLE.name: alphanumeric_suffix
EXAMPLE.description: EXAMPLE followed by 3-6 alphanumeric chars. Matches EXAMPLEabc, EXAMPLE1a2b
